column3: > ... if we want this job to have 24GB of memory, we need to increase the CPU count to 6.\n\n... or use Compute Credits.
ACK if CI is happy with this

>  if CI is happy with this

CI seems to be happy enough to not insta-fail due to mis-configuration. The [failing job](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21609/checks?check_run_id=2274150365) (not modified here) has timed out after 2 hours:

> #12646	INITED cov: 19489 ft: 128011 corp: 3594/4992Kb exec/s: 49 rss: 835Mb
> #12646	DONE   cov: 19489 ft: 128011 corp: 3594/4992Kb lim: 5987
Should we split up the fuzz job into two?

@sipa If we want to speed up the fuzz job another route could be to simply remove large inputs which don't contribute to increased coverage. I think many (all?) of the very large inputs were added to the qa-assets repo by mistake, not that they added coverage historically :)\n\nSee the open issue https://github.com/bitcoin-core/qa-assets/issues/56: "Consider removing unnecessarily large inputs w
